pros: If you have the right supervisor, you will be able to have somewhat of a work-life balance. Knowing that you are making a difference in someone's life
cons: Short staffed, gas lighting, some supervisors do not step up to help when needed

pros: My patients know I work hard trying to make their stay in the facility a positive experience.
cons:
1-3 CNAs per 50 patients, 1 nurse, and 1 pill pusher
Showers, you're lucky if you get one a month
Medication is not distributed as directed. Here's all you medications, all at once, just take them
You have to go to the bathroom, put your call light on and wait. You may get lucky and get toileted within my shift.
Come in and get paid whether you work or not, we can't afford to fire a warm body. Always looks good on paper.
Need I go on....

pros: bonuses for picking up hours, OT after 8hours

review_title: Marquardt Villiage.  Home Care and Hospice
job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) in La Crosse, WI
pros: Get a car and gas card to do home visits. Also given own phone and i pad. You get your own independence. Good hourly wage.
cons: Benefits not the greatest. Not much help in orientation process.
Skilled nursing facility needs renovation to compete

review_title: Becker Shoop Center - Nursing Home in Racine, WI.
cons: Extreme, high turn-over of nursing staff.  Management concerned only with profit.  Company does not deliver what it promises and is totally out of touch with it's work force. Staff  does not trust company to be honest, low morale due to bad management. Staff does not respect the management. State survey results were poor. Building, computer and phone system all in need of replacing. Unhappy , unorganized, delivers poor quality.
